citations.narrative:
The licensee is not maintaining complete medical records for an adult dog. Records indicate an adult female Bernese
Mountain Dog (ID#9738) is receiving wound spray treatments for the ears. The instructions from the Attending
Veterinarian state to apply the treatment at least twice a day for 7 to 10 days. The medical record shows that the topical
treatment was administered on August 25th and August 28th but the licensee states that they have been applying the
topical medication as directed by the Attending Veterinarian (at least twice a day for 7 to 10 days). The licensee did not
record all of the treatments administered or all of the dates of administration for these treatments. Failure to maintain
adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are receiving
adequate veterinary care. Additionally, complete medical records ensure that all personnel at the facility are clear on the
plan for treatment and enables the licensee to evaluate effectiveness of the plan and ensure that the condition is
corrected. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all vaccines and treatments
administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and ensure that medical
records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 31-AUG-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
